text: John A. Rice was a member of the Wisconsin State Senate. ==Biography== Rice was born on March 17, 1832 in Ticonderoga, New York. In 1851, he graduated from Western Reserve Medical College and moved to Merton, Wisconsin. Rice married Caroline Caswell in 1852. They had four children before her death in 1864. ==Career== Rice was first elected to the Senate from the 10th District in 1869. In 1871, he was a candidate for Lieutenant Governor of Wisconsin, losing to Milton Pettit. Additionally, Rice was School Superintendent and Chairman of the Town Board of Merton. He was a Democrat. ==References== Category:People from Ticonderoga, New York Category:People from Merton, Wisconsin Category:Wisconsin state senators Category:American school superintendents Category:Wisconsin Democrats Category:Physicians from Wisconsin Category:Case Western Reserve University School of Medicine alumni Category:1832 births Category:Year of death missing Category:Educators from New York (state)
title: John A. Rice (politician)
